description: Wearing her blonde locks swept to one side, the mother-of-four sported a dramatic smokey-eye and nude lipstick for the occasion.
title: Golden Globes 2016 red carpet joined by Cate Blanchett in unusual pink gown
title_page: Golden Globes 2016 red carpet joined by Cate Blanchett in unusual pink gown | Daily Mail Online
text:
She's known for her understated style and love of simple silhouettes.
But Cate Blanchett opted for an unusual pale pink and fringed gown at the 2016 Golden Globes.
Taking to the red carpet in Los Angeles on Sunday night, the 46-year-old actress turned heads as she posed for photographs in the Twenties-inspired Givenchy design.
Scroll down for video
Turning heads: Cate Blanchett opted for an unusual pale pink and fringe design to attend the 2016 Golden Globes
Wearing her blonde locks swept to one side, the mother-of-four sported a dramatic smokey-eye and nude lipstick for the occasion.
She added a drop earrings and glittering bracelet by Tiffany & Co. to her look, allowing her show-stopping dress to command full attention.
The candy pink frock featured a high neckline and quarter-length sleeves, with thin fringe dropping from the actress's shoulders.
See live updates from the Golden Globes 2016 with more of the latest red carpet pictures
Intricate: The Givenchy design featured fringing and a detailed pattern which swept down its back
Show-stopping: Cate opted for simple accessories, allowing the dress to command full attention on the red carpet
It boasted an intricately patterned bodice and sweeping skirt made entirely of tassels.
Keeping the rest of her look simple, Cate carried just a small black clutch bag in one hand.
Cate is nominated for Best Actress in a Motion Picture Drama for her role in the film Carol.
Starring alongside Rooney Mara, the Australian beauty plays the character of a 1950s housewife who finds herself drawn into a lesbian affair.
Natural beauty: Cate sported a dramatic smokey-eye and a nude hue of lipstick to finish her red carpet look
Dazzling: The 46-year-old added some drop earrings and a sparkling cuff bracelet by Tiffany & Co. to her glamorous look
Speaking of the project recently, Cate told of her excitement at having been able to work alongside the film's director, Todd Haynes.
'What’s interesting about the film that Todd’s made, and also about Patricia Highsmith’s novel, is that in the end it’s about falling in love,' she told Deadline.
'And it’s as much about the age gap between the women as it is about the outsider nature of their love.
'And so he’s made a beautiful film about falling in love and heartbreak and maturity.'
Rooney is nominated in the same category for her role as Therese Belive.
